label: Validates that the rows in a table has all its mandatory columns
description: Validates that the rows in a table has all its mandatory columns. This rule uses the `partID`, `<table_name>Table`, <table_name>Required` columns in the dictionary to generate the corresponding cerberus fields.
messageText: Missing mandatory column <columnName> in table <tableName> in row number <rowIndex>

label: Validates a categorical column
description: Validates that the values in a categorical column in a table are part of the category set for that column
messageText: Invalid category <invalid_category_value> found in row <row_index> for column <column_name> in table <table_name>

label: Validates that a primary key is not invalidly duplicated in a table.
description: This rules validates that if two rows have the same primary key, they both refer to the same entry. It does this by checking that the lastUpdated field is different.
messageText: Duplicate entries found in rows <row_indexes> for primary key column <column_name> in table <table_name>

label: Validates that a number value is not less than a minimum value
description: Validates that a number value is not less than a minimum value
messageText: Value <invalid_value> in row <row_index> in column <column_name> in table <table_name> is less than the allowable minimum value of <min_value>

label: Validates that a number value is not greater than a maximum value
description: Validates that a number value is not greater than a maximum value
messageText: Value <invalid_value> in row <row_index> in column <column_name> in table <table_name> is greater than the allowable maximum value of <max_value>

label: Validates that a mandatory column does not have null values
description: The ODM dictionary provides a list of parts that are represent missing. This rule ensures that mandatory columns do not contain these values.
messageText: Mandatory column <column_name> in table <table_name> contains missing value <invalid_value> in row index <row_index>

label: Validates the minimum length of a string type
description: The minLength column in the ODM dictionary documents the minimum that a part should have. This validation implements it.
messageText: Value <invalid_value> in row <row_index> in column <column_name> in table <table_name> has length <invalid_length> which is less than the min length of <min_length>

label: Validates the maximum length of a string type
description: The maxLength column in the ODM dictionary documents the minimum that a part should have. This validation implements it.
messageText: Value <invalid_value> in row <row_index> in column <column_name> in table <table_name> has length <invalid_length> which is greater than the max length of <max_length>

label: Validates type of a value
description: Uses the dataType column to check if a value is the correct type or can be coerced into the correct type
messageText: Value <invalid_value> in row <row_index> in column <column_name> in table <table_name> has type <invalid_value_type> but should be of type <valid_type> or coercable into a <valid_type>.
